messages: 9e78a3abacbbf15e1b9e9d467b67bc1b (09:07): can anybody help me on how i can make mysql listen in on ip
9e78a3abacbbf15e1b9e9d467b67bc1b (09:13): Couldn't connect to 67.52.187.22:3306/tcp: IO::Socket::INET: connect: Connection refused at /home/cron/AST_VDhopper.pl line 141
9e78a3abacbbf15e1b9e9d467b67bc1b (09:13): Couldn't connect to 67.52.187.22:3306/tcp: IO::Socket::INET: connect: Connection refused at /home/cron/AST_vm_update.pl line 83
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:14): Check my.cnf for bind-address or skip-networking
9e78a3abacbbf15e1b9e9d467b67bc1b (09:20): can i fully allow a certain ip
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:28): Try using a different client.
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:28): So you can get a better error message.
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:35): Any client that will give you a MySQL error message.
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:35): Make sure the server is running :)
9e78a3abacbbf15e1b9e9d467b67bc1b (09:36): root@PHP:~# A mysqld process already exists
3d1c77caeb9b9e7036a0a76031508dd9 (09:37): someone help me why this command SELECT TIME_FORMAT(TIMEDIFF(CURTIME(), '2006-08-03 23:15:20'), '%H%i%s') always returns null?
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:37): How about using NOW() instead.
3d1c77caeb9b9e7036a0a76031508dd9 (09:38): hmm there's any way to just use the time part of the string?
9e78a3abacbbf15e1b9e9d467b67bc1b (09:41): can i bind the ip of the client
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:47): Means MySQL can listen to external connection.
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:47): So your problem is probably with authentication. Bad username/password. Go from there.
9e78a3abacbbf15e1b9e9d467b67bc1b (09:49): would that be on mysql server or asterisk server
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:49): Your MySQL username and password is probably wrong.
9e78a3abacbbf15e1b9e9d467b67bc1b (09:51): im burnt out been working on this for a week
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:52): So take a break. "I can't! I need this up by tomorrow" Well, you won't get it up tomorrow.
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:53): We heard that all the time.
9e78a3abacbbf15e1b9e9d467b67bc1b (09:53): do i put cron in my.cnf
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:54): How are you going to put cron in your my.cnf?
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:56): That secion is where you place flags to clients that read my.cnf
9e78a3abacbbf15e1b9e9d467b67bc1b (09:56): im sorry im new at this
9e78a3abacbbf15e1b9e9d467b67bc1b (09:56): so i cant put cron there

b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:57): For example, the "mysql" client reads that section for additional flags. Don't worry. That's why I'm explaining it to you. But you shouldn't just guess. Like I said before, use a different client, like the mysql client.
9e78a3abacbbf15e1b9e9d467b67bc1b (09:57): what do you mean different client
9e78a3abacbbf15e1b9e9d467b67bc1b (09:58): i thought i was using that
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:58): What are you typing in?
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (09:59): That tells you how to use the mysql client. What flags you need. Read it.
9e78a3abacbbf15e1b9e9d467b67bc1b (10:00): how come my mysql is v4.1
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (10:01): Do you really expect me to answer that?
b8fdf433399075466782e3be1b46452c (10:01): If your client is 4.1, it will connect fine to 4.0.
